page.title: 09VIDEO DISCS 2 - BLACKBURN
page.content: When the master has been produced it can be used in the next stage of disc making. A nickle Stamper is made from the Master and if the Stamper is found to be perfect then the Stamper will be used to make thousands of discs in the Replicating process. The final disc is made from plastic granules which are melted at a temperature of 175C and then injected into a disc shape. The Stamper is then pressed into the plastic at a force of 200 tons. The discs are made in two halves and a silver solution is sprayed on to each half before they are stuck together. The disc is then cut to the correct size to ensure that it fits neatly into the disc player. All the discs are tested to a high standard. Finally the discs are labelled and packed before being dispatched to the customer.
